headline: Cedar Planked Salmon
description: Cedar-plank salmon is tops for flavor. This streamlined recipe uses a quick soy, scallion, and ginger marinade that's speedy enough for weeknights.

video.description: See how to make cedar planked salmon with a simple Asian marinade.
video.name: Cedar Planked Salmon

name: Cedar Planked Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Soak cedar planks for at least 1 hour in warm water. Soak longer if you have time.
Stir together soy sauce, vegetable oil, rice vinegar, sesame oil, green onions, ginger, and garlic in a shallow dish.
Place salmon fillets in soy mixture and turn to coat. Cover and marinate for at least 15 minutes, or up to 1 hour refrigerated.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat. Place planks on the grill grate. Heat planks until they start to smoke and crackle just a little.
Remove salmon from marinade and place on planks; discard marinade.
Close grill cover. Grill salmon until it flakes easily with a fork, about 20 minutes; salmon will continue to cook after you remove it from the grill.

review.reviewBody: Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing. It was an easy recipe to follow, and above all delicious!

[In regards to the video]; These cedar planks aren't cheap! One of the salmon filets could have easily fit onto one of the planks, or cut the filets in half. Also, it's a waste to use green onions in the marinate. I saved mine to place on the filets after they're cooked. The garlic & ginger overwhelm the marinate with their flavoring, so the onions contribute little.
The salmon was moist with all the right flavors. Will make again for sure.

Let me start by saying cedar plank salmon is the absolute very best!! I've been doing it that way since I first tasted cedar plank salmon at Anthony's in Seattle. I always used a simple lightly-seasoned approach but read this recipe and tried this variation. It's excellent. A few suggestions: 1. I buy cedar fence slats at the lumber yard and cut them up. MUCH cheaper. 2. I leave the skin on. 3. I heat up my grill on high and then put on the planks. I then let the planks warm up. The salmon is cooked by the hot plank, steam coming from the plank and the hot air inside the grill. 4. 20 minutes is too long for my grill. I like the salmon to do some browning on top but take care not to over-cook any fish.

So far the best recipe for cooking salmon I tried. I didn‚Äôt have fresh ginger so used 1 tsp of ginger powder instead while keeping the rest of the ingredients unchanged. I kept the salmon skin on, made multiple cuts and placed the skin side on the plank. I also added few slices of Lemon on top. The result was great with many compliments from our guests üòã
The salmon tasted great and wasn‚Äôt dry. The flavor from the marinade was pleasant and not overpowering.
This was super easy & so delicious!
This was amazing!!!! I will eat fish but it's not my first choice, this however is.
I made other cedar plank recipes that were ok. This was the best!! Husband loved it!
Very tasty and easy to make. Definitely will make it again

I generally dislike fish and especially salmon, but tried this as part of a diet I am on. It. Was. Delicious. I let this marinade for 2 hours this afternoon (soaked the planks for the same amount of time). Cooked on the center of a Weber gas grill set to medium with a heating plate. The grill thermometer showed 500 F. Set a timer for 14 minutes for a first check and it looked perfect so I pulled it. It was moist, flaky perfection. Highly recommend.

Cedar planks are our best friends. Soak them. I love the recipe. Suggestion: Reserve a bit of marinade untouched by raw fish. Mix in a bit of 100% maple syrup plus a bit of diced shallot. 1-2 minutes to go on grill, hit it. Instant caramelize. Finish with a small squeeze of lemon, fresh pepper grind and taste the flavor of it all. BTW: This can be done in an oven with reliable broiler function.
Perfect! The little details really helped- it was delicious!
I have made this several as it is or go to recipe for salmon. It's the best salmon recipe. That's all I have to say about that.
I love this recipe. It‚Äôs my Go To, for salmon and steelhead.
Very good as is. On second try, I added 2 tablespoons of local honey for a little sweetness, highly recommend it.
I couldn't help but add brown sugar to the marinade. I like a little sweetness to salmon. The marinade had a good flavor .
Cedar planked salmon would have been good, but marinade made this excellent!

Fantastic! I did add some red pepper flakes and lemon slices as a garnish.

It‚Äôs a keeper!
My only go to salmon recipe. My late Asian mother was disappointed after ordering salmon at a restaurant after I made her this recipe.
So delicious! I've made it twice in 3 weeks.

First off this turned out to be some of the best fish I‚Äôve literally ever had I think! I soaked my plank a little over an hour and I think it did fine. I topped the salmon w/ some honey before cooking. I‚Äôll definitely make this again.

I doubled the recipe for 12 of us. Children and grandchildren ( 5 under the age of 8) raved about it and all wanted more (unusual for the little ones). I soaked the planks for 6 hours and oiled the top surface prior to putting the salmon on it as suggested in another review. The planks did not go on fire, the salmon cooked to perfection and I was able to easily wash the planks after dinner with hot water. This allows me to use them again. Will definitely keep this recipe and do it again.

I used the ingredients as listed. I soaked the cedar planks overnight and marinated the salmon for 30 minutes in a ziploc bag. Two days later my guests were still calling with complements and to find out how I prepared it. I‚Äôll be making it again soon.
This is by far the best and only way to cook salmon.

LOVE IT SO MUCH!!
This is the only salmon recipe we use! We have done it with and without the cedar plank. If we do it without, my husband makes it on aluminum foil on the grill. It‚Äôs flavorful, moist and does not taste fishy! Lots of strong ingredients in the marinade but none of them are overpowering.
I've made this quite a few times and it's amazing every time

Made this recipe for company everyone loved it! Soaked planks for about 8 hours, did not use garlic & sesame oil. Otherwise followed recipe exactly. Marinated fish for 15 minutes next time will marinate longer. Delicious!
By far the best plank salmon I have made
This was ‚Äúthe bomb‚Äù! Followed the prep directions, 20 minutes at 375 on my new Kamado grill. Best salmon recipe ever!
Absolutely awesome on a charcoal Weber grill! Follow the recipe as is and you will have the most moist flavorful salmon you have ever tasted!

If possible I would give this 6 stars. It is simply fabulous. We are always preferring to try new recipes, change things up, etc, but when it comes to salmon we stick to this recipe. One little tip I would share, is let the cedar planks flare up a lot, this gives the salmon a bit of a ‚Äúcrisp‚Äù to it and imparts a lovely smokey flavour. We have enjoyed it countless times with asparagus and riced cauliflower - thanks for sharing it!!
Wow! Just finished having this with some grilled asparagus for lunch. Easy and delicious! I‚Äôll be making this often! Thanks for sharing this recipe.
This is a wonderful recipe. It was a hit for everyone.
This turns out really tasty! I have made it several times on the Weber and the only change I‚Äôve made is using low sodium soy sauce as the cedar smoke gives it sort of a salty flavor on its own.
LOVE IT! We make it all the time. Great with good quality fresh salmon!!!
Excellent recipe and result - tweaked by adding a small amount of brown sugar to marinade.
This turned out better than any other cedar plank salmon that I have tried. Thank you!!
I found it to be very tasty. And as important as it is to not overcook it, beware as well of undercooking it.

My husband and I make this salmon all the time. It is one of our favorite meals to make for guests. Everyone loves it. We use diced yellow onions and the individually frozen salmon from Costco with no skin.
My planks caught on fire, even after soaking them for over an hour. After salvaging the salmon and finish cooking, the flavor was delicious,

I have made this receipt over 50X in the last few years. My family loves it. Hubby and daughter will only eat salmon if I use this receipt or make it with a teriyaki glaze. Of the two, this recipe is their favorite.
First fish I‚Äôve ever cooked. Easy and delicious.
This recipe is fantastic!! I would make this again!! DELICIOUS!!!
This recipe is fantastic!! I would make this again!! DELICIOUS!!!
Easily the best salmon I have ever eaten

Made it! Followed the recipe to the letter the first time. It was was amazing. The changes I would make the next time: marinade longer, marinade deeper in the marinade, either remove the skin or cook skin side up so the cedar flavor is absorbed more into the fish. (I do like crispy skin.). Also, would cook it less time - it continued to cook and the last piece we ate was a little firmer than I prefer. Unlike some others, I had no trouble with burning planks. But I had no fire under the wood.
This is a winner EVERY time. I like use steelhead the best.
I made this last night. Preparation was easy and it turned out great! Very flavorful! To me, this recipe is the best way to cook wild caught salmon!
Made this for lunch today and it was delicious! This is definitely be a keeper!!
The best salmon recipe for me so far. I used sockeye and left the skin on. Turned out perfect.
I added a little brown sugar to the marinade. It was delicious!
Make it all the time. My go-to salmon recipe because everybody I serve it to, loves it!
This was delicious but it was enough for 8-10 people
Wow, exceptional! I just used two planks, 1 pound filet on each. 20 minutes was just slightly too long for my grill's medium heat, next time I'll check it at 18 minutes or so.
Absolutely delicious! Great flavour and easy to make. Wish I had made more!
Followed the directions exactly and it came out perfect!
First time using a cedar plank. My husband and son loved this salmon. Will definitely make it again.

O.k., I have at least 32 book-marked Allrecipes recipes on my iPad and I‚Äôve never written a review. (I‚Äôm one of the leaches who listens to the music on NPR and gives no $, haha). So, when I tell you this is the best thing I ever served ( and I followed the recipe precisely), it ought to mean something!

I just made this twice in the past week for two different dinner gatherings and it was a big hit both times. I made a minor tweak to the recipe by adding 1-2Tb of brown sugar. I also tried using this recipe as a marinade for jumbo grilled shrimp and it was amazing. This recipe is a crowd pleaser; even the kids gobbled it up! A new family favorite!
I loved this cedar plank plank recipe! I used fresh herbs also....a keeper!
Best salmon recipe I've had

this is an amazing recipe! i have done it so many times. filled the recipe. Remember to discard the marinade. do NOT baste the salmon! my hubby did that once and it was mushy! Recipe as written...restaurant quality!
Loved it! No leftovers for this salmon!
No changes! Best salmon I've ever made. Did it on my indoor grill-top. House smelled awesome for a week! The smokey flavor was delicious.

Oh god, this is beyond incredible. This has officially replaced my go-to salmon planning recipe I‚Äôve been doing for a good decade or so now. I added red pepper flakes to the fish once I had it on the cedar, but the rest is verbatim from the recipe. YUM!!
What a great and easy recipes to create something yummy ! Fully of flavor and easy to make ....
I really liked this dish! It is easy to make. I did not use a cedar plank and broiled the salmon in the oven instead.
It's sooo good! My favorite recipe for salmon now!
It tasted SO good. Great flavor. I‚Äôll be making it again for sure.
i ended up doing it in the oven at 180c, my husband loved it!!!
Delicious! I served this with my own garlic fried rice recipe, steamed broccoli, and broccoli slaw tossed in Japanese Hibachi House style ginger dressing! The BEST dinner! Thanks for the recipe!

I‚Äôd give this 10 STARS, if I could! My husband and three kids all love salmon ‚Äî they‚Äôll eat it with the most minimal preparation, just thrown in a pan. But I can‚Äôt stand it. I have NEVER been able to eat and enjoy salmon... until this recipe. I LOVE that this recipe has made me, a confirmed non-salmon-eater, into a salmon lover. Thank you, Wendy!
Great recipe! We planked it on the grill and it was fantastic
Made it today and its fantastic!
Excellent flavour. Excellent aroma! Very easy and thoroughly enjoyed! Even in the age of quarantine, two of us (only) enjoyed a wonderful dinner.

Didn't have the cedar planks so I baked in the oven! Excellent!
I will definitely cook it again!

I had never cooked nor cared for salmon until I caught my first one here in the pnw and found this recipie... since then I've made it several times for friends and family and everybody raves! Thank you so much for this delicious recipe! You made a salmon lover out of this girl!
My 13 year old son and I made this one together. It was delicious! We used a 2.22 lbs filet.
No changes. Yes.

This is now my all-time favorite fish recipe, regardless of the type of fish. I followed the ingredients exactly, and highly recommend the extra effort of fresh ginger and garlic over the dry stuff. The only thing I did differently was I baked it in the oven. I still used the cedar plank and soaked it, then I lined a cookie sheet with foil and placed the plank on a wire rack over the cookie sheet. Baked at 360F until fish was 145F inside and it came out moist, flaky, and tender.
I didn‚Äôt grill it . Put the cedar in the oven. Didn‚Äôt smoke any. Will try again in the future

This is so easy to make and I feel like a professional every time I make it! I have found that wildwoodgrillingoutlet.com has by far the cheapest planks in bulk! Now I've been trying to plank everything from meats, veggies and fruits.
Delicious way to cook salmon. One of my favourite recipes. Cut back just a bit on the soy sauce but otherwise followed the recipe.
I will definitely make it again!!!!!

Absolutely delicious! I love salmon and this is clearly one of the best salmon dishes I've ever eaten. Full of flavor and moist. Made the marinade exactly as written except omitted the ginger. Marinated for about 45 minutes. Soaked the planks for almost 4 hrs and had no flames. Will be able to re-use the planks at least a couple of more times.
Great easy recipe!
This was definitely a five star dish. I followed the recipe exactly as written and this was the best salmon I‚Äôve ever had. Just be sure to soak the cedar plank so it doesn‚Äôt catch fire.

This was truly delicious! I have only just started to like salmon and recipes like this really help me to enjoy it! Made it exactly as written. One thing my hubbie did is he turned the salmon over directly onto the grill just to grill it up a little then put it back on the plank. Added a nice little crunch to the top.

I thought the recipe was terrific. Never used cedar planks before. The 4-star vs. 5 was because hubby said he didn't see it worth the effort but again, the copycat Longhorn Steak House recipe is what I usually use which really is pretty awesome. Just have to have some quality bourbon lying around the house.

I followed the recipe exactly... but my family still prefers the other recipe from this site, Blackened Salmon.
I soaked my boards for over 24 hours, followed all the directions & still my boards basically burned, the fish was not burned, but this was crazy... with the amount of smoke it made. the taste I was told, was good, but they prefer the other recipe, and since I do not eat salmon, I cannot judge this dish.
it was delicious , very moist and very tasty .
I would suggest extending the marinate time to at least hours in the fridg.
This is so yummy! We love the Asian flavours and it‚Äôs become are go-to salmon recipe! Thank you!
I will try again, marinated too long. My salmon steaks were frozen, should have checked on them sooner.
Wonderful! Thanks for sharing your recipe!

Making this tonight. Hubby works at a shop n is bringing home cedar plank. I did not have all ingredients. Substituted dried onions for green; powdered ginger for fresh, etc.
Hubby is not big on salmon, but I cannot wait!
Best coho salmon ever. Twenty minutes at medium heat was about 325 degrees. Perfectly cooked. Good marinade, nice and simple. I left it in for two hours. Served with barbecued eggplant.
Made exactly as written... fantastic! Will definitely be my go to any time I grill salmon going* forward!
